result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Kerber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation on Cases 15CM93 and 15CF296.

Court grants 176 days credit.
TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court strikes the repeater in Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
JAIL:  176 DAYS, CREDIT 176 DAYS, TIME SERVED.
COSTS: $253.00.(to be paid a condition of probation on 2015CM93 and 2015CF296)
DNA surcharge:  Waived based on date of violation.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: Nov 2, 2015, Joshua Kerber
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-02-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will not enroll in drug/treatment court. Defense requests a date for a plea/sentencing in 2 weeks. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that the jury status date be used for a plea/sentencing date. Court grants request. Jury trial is adjourned. Motion hearing is withdrawn.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/5/15.
Hearing at 10-05-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Hearing on August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Mary Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date in 30 days. Court grants request.  Defense to advise on the next date how this matter will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J Kerber in court, in custody, via video with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises this matter is progressing as set. Defendant is completing his ATR. Defense requests bail be modified to a signature bond on 15CM121 with the same conditions. Court grants request and modifies bail to $750.00 signature bond on file 15CM121. Bail to remain as set on the other files. Cases continued as set.
Hearing on July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court.   Defendant Joshua J Kerber did not appear.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 10:50. Court contacted the facility via video where the defendant was at, but defendant was not there. Defense advised his client is to do a 90 day program at MSDF. Time limits are tolled on 15CF296. Defense requests a date in 90 days for a Preliminary Hearing. Court grants request.  Court will also give another date in 45 days to review the defendant's status. Defendant to appear by video.  Hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Dated 4/18/15 filed by Attorney Fragoso requesting that the court modify the defendant's bond and that his appearance be waived for the April 22, 2015 hearing.
